title: david678345
author: david678345
content: Hi, I wanted to convert my bitcoin into usdt on coinbase but it won't let me...it tells me that no totalstotals less than 0.00000408 are not allowed.according to the calculator that equals to 0.10 usdtand I have much more than that amount....is anyone the same thing happening to you?Sorry for my English

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: david678345 on February 16, 2023, 03:37:39 PMHi, I wanted to convert my bitcoin into usdt on coinbase but it won't let me...it tells me that no totalstotals less than 0.00000408 are not allowed.according to the calculator that equals to 0.10 usdtand I have much more than that amount...is anyone the same thing happening to you?Sorry for my EnglishI rarely use coinbase but just on a general note, if you are using a coinbase app then it may be a result of the app being outdated and you may need to update the app or you visit the exchange using your browser. -because that amount presented in the calculated is recognised as dust amount and with that input, you can't make any transaction from that account. -There are likely two reasons that thos may happen, first one I have explained but another reason may be that your UTSTD is not in your funding wallet,Â  so you will have to move the balance to the spending balance so that your balance can be caption during the transaction.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: The question is, the total you have, is it in BTC or another coin but valued in USD.Most exchanges don't allow trading below a minimum of 10 USD/USDT... How much are you trying to convert?If you face a lot of challenges, try contacting Coinbase support for quicker help regarding the issue.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Is this a Coinbase wallet or the Coinbase pro?I'm using Coinbase wallet before and it always has bugs like transaction delays or stuck transaction even it is confirmed.What device have you currently tried to exchange your Bitcoin to USDT?If it's on the PC I suggest try their app or if you are on mobile try to log in on a web browser and test it there

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: How's the conversion preview looking? There were cases of crypto to crypto conversions having a 1 dollar CB fee... if we're talking about a very small amount, perhaps look if the fee is eating your trade, otherwise, start writing to coinbase ig.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Show some image on how the error looks like but if it seems to be under a dollar or the value is in centavos then that's not really enough. Just as they said, exchanges have minimum amounts for conversion and transactions. Like in Binance, it is requiring $10 amount minimum in crypto for you to convert and trade it. Having that said, your balance isn't really enough to proceed with the transaction/conversion.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on February 16, 2023, 11:55:17 PMIs this a Coinbase wallet or the Coinbase pro?Wasn't Coinbase pro discontinued already?If I am not mistaken, I must have read an email from them stating that they were going to discontinue the Coinbase pro product and merge it into coinbase.com as one.Edit:This is the announcement: Hello Advanced Trade, goodbye Coinbase Pro
